cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential – not yet hurricane strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi (125 km) NNW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northeast on Friday, cross the southern/central Florida peninsula Saturday, then accelerate northeastward off the Atlantic coast toward the waters east of Georgia–South Carolina and eventually toward Bermuda.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida peninsula (near the southwest coast between Naples and Fort Myers)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West coast FL south of Middle of Longboat Key; east coast FL south of the Volusia/Brevard County line; Florida Keys; Cuban western provinces; north-western Bahamas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, and later the Atlantic waters offshore of northeast Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at Jacksonville (only ~3 % chance of 34-kt winds). Breezy conditions (20–30 kt gusts) possible Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; onshore surge below 1 ft along the northeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Generally 1–2 inches possible from outer rain bands Sunday; localized higher totals remain south of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and hazardous marine conditions in the approaches and St. Johns River entrance Sunday–early Monday; rip currents along area beaches.
